page.title: 07Belper Lane End (1)
page.content: Mrs.Wesson showed us four cottages which used to be for farm labourers. They are now made into two and she lives in one. On the wall is a sign which means it is 600ft above sea level. On{Jesses Lane}there used to be a hole in the ground next to the road. All the women in the village used to meet to do their washing and have a gossip. There may have been a well. {St.Faith's Church}was built in 1890 by the Convent of St.Lawrence and St.Faith was chosen because she was burned just the same as St. Lawrence. She lived in the 3rd Century in the S. of France. The Emperor Diocletian wanted her to worship him but she said she only worshipped Jesus Christ. She was burnt alive. She was only 16 years old.
